Vampires

3.67 from 3 votes

Created: Nov. 8th, 2009

Tags:Vampires

 

  • Edward Cullen

    Via My Soul Belong To Rob_Pttz

    The sensitive vampire heartthrob who doesn't feed on humans. What's not to love?

  • Barnabas Collins

    Barnabas Collins comes to us from the late 1960's vampire soap, Dark Shawdows. At 175 years old, the debonaire vampire was so effective at capturing audiences, he saved the show from being cancelled when he was intruduced in the second season, to an otherwise unpopular show.

    Rumour has it that Johnny Depp will be playing Barnabas Collins in an upcoming Tim Burton re-imagining of the classic show. Personally I couldn't thing of anactor better fit for the roll.

  • Lestat de Lioncourt

    From Anne Rice's novel series, The Vampire Chronicles, Lestat is one of the most complex vampires to captue our imaginations. Played excellently well by both Tom Cruise in Interview with the Vampire and by Stuart Townsend in Queen of the Damned.

  • Dracula

    Count Dracula is the most infamous of all time because he is based upon a real person: Vald the Impaler. Vlad was an unfriendly sort whose hobbies included burning folks alive, and coming up with creative ways to slowly kill others with large wooden steakes, thus the Impaler title.

    Bram Stoker published the novel Dracula in 1897. The nefarious character has been the focus in films an tv many time since, and like will be many times more.
